```{r, engine='Rcpp'}
#include <Rcpp.h>
// [[Rcpp::export]]
Rcpp::IntegerVector myBinner(Rcpp::NumericVector myVect, float bin_width = 0.2){

  int i = 0;
  int j = 0;
  int nbins = 1/bin_width;
  Rcpp::NumericVector breaks( nbins + 1 );
  Rcpp::IntegerVector counts(nbins);
  
  breaks(0) = 0;
  for(i=1; i<=nbins; i++){
    breaks(i) = breaks(i-1) + bin_width;
  }
  
  for(i=0; i<breaks.size(); i++){
    Rcpp::Rcout << breaks(i) << "\n";
  }
  
  Rcpp::Rcout << "\nBinning!\n\n";
  
  for(i=0; i<myVect.size(); i++){
    
    j = 0;
    if( myVect(i) >= breaks(j) & myVect(i) <= breaks(j+1) ){
      Rcpp::Rcout << "Binned: " <<  myVect(i) << " is >= " << breaks(j) << " & <= " << breaks(j+1) << "\n";
      counts(j)++;
    }    
    for(j=1; j<nbins; j++){
      if( myVect(i) > breaks(j) & myVect(i) <= breaks(j+1) ){
        Rcpp::Rcout << "Binned: " <<  myVect(i) << " is > " << breaks(j) << " & <= " << breaks(j+1) << "\n";
        counts(j)++;
      }
    }
  }
  
  return(counts);  
}

```




```{r}
set.seed(9)
#x <- runif(n=4)
x <- c(0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.0)
myBinner(x)
```
